content.description: Sit start the right side of the boulder with your left hand on a thin sidepull and your right hand on a pinchy hold up higher. Move your right to a thin crimp, then move up the arête, and top out.
content.location: This ascends the second boulder that faces the trail.

content.description: Sit start the undercut boulder. Start with your left hand on semi-decent crimp and your right hand on a slopey half-pad. Bump your right with poor feet, and then make several powerful moves up with bad feet and minimal hands. Top out.
content.location: This is on the first steep undercut boulder you reach. The problem faces the brush dump.

content.description: Squat start and climb the right arête on the backside of the boulder that faces away from the trail.
content.location: It is on the third boulder, the largest boulder.

content.description: Sit start the far left side of the second boulder. Move up, and traverse right to top out. This has funky beta.
content.location: This ascends the left arête on the second boulder that faces the trail.

content.description: From the parking lot, walk to the brush dump and take the right just before the dump. Walk about 3-4 minutes, and look left to see these blocks about 30-40 feet into the woods.
